action.action-desc: Mr. Lawler (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Ryan, Ms. Stevens, Mr. Pappas, Ms. Tlaib, and Ms. Pingree) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To prohibit the procurement of certain items containing perfluorooctane sulfonate or perfluorooctanoic acid and prioritize the procurement of products not containing PFAS.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the PFAS–Free Procurement Act of 2025.

section.header: Prohibition on procurement of certain items containing PFOS or PFOA

subsection.text: The head of an executive agency may not renew or enter into a contract for the procurement of a covered item that contains PFOS or PFOA.

subsection.header: Priority procurement of products not containing pfas
subsection.text: The head of an executive agency shall prioritize the procurement of covered items, where available and practicable, that do not contain PFAS.

paragraph.text: The term executive agency has the meaning given the term in section 133 of title 41, United States Code.

subparagraph.text: nonstick cookware and a cooking utensil; and
furniture, carpet, and any rug treated with stain-resistant coating.

paragraph.text: The term PFAS means harmful perfluoroalkyl or polyfluoroalkyl substances.
The term PFOA means perfluorooctanoic acid.
The term PFOS means perfluorooctane sulfonate.

subsection.text: This section shall take effect 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act and shall apply with respect to any contract entered into on and after such effective date.
